See also: miete, mieté, and miętę

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German miete, from Old High German miata, from Proto-Germanic *mēzdō, *mizdō (“meed”), from Proto-Indo-European *misdʰós, from Proto-Indo-European *mey- (“to exchange”). Cognates include Proto-Indo-Iranian *miždʰám, Old Church Slavonic мьзда (mьzda, “reward”) and English meed (“recompense, payment, reward”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈmiːtə/
  • Audio (Austria)
    		(file)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Miete f (genitive Miete, plural Mieten)

  1. rent
